title: Calories in Salt
meta_description: Discover calories in salt (zero, as expected), plus sodium content, nutrition breakdown per teaspoon, and common FAQs for dietary tracking.
assumptions: Table salt (sodium chloride), fine grain, standard iodized variety; 1 tsp ≈ 5.7 g.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by type (table, sea, kosher), grain size, and brand; sodium levels can differ slightly. Check labels when available.
label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Use kosher salt (flakier, ≈3 g per tsp equivalent)

faqs.a: No, salt has 0 calories—it's pure sodium chloride with no energy content.

faqs.q: How much sodium is in 1 teaspoon of salt?
faqs.a: About 2325 mg, which is roughly the daily recommended limit for adults.

faqs.q: Are there calories in different types of salt?
faqs.a: No, table, sea, or Himalayan salt all have 0 calories; only sodium varies slightly.

faqs.q: Why track calories in salt if it's zero?
faqs.a: Salt impacts sodium intake for blood pressure and heart health, even without calories.

faqs.q: What's the calorie difference between table salt and salt substitutes?
faqs.a: Both have 0 calories, but substitutes often have less sodium and added potassium.
